options: Eat something with that terrible smell
Speak without proper legal representation present
Wear casual clothing instead of formal business attire
Challenge the authority of the presiding judges directly
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'Eat something with that terrible smell'. The text states 'Même devant la Cour suprême, je ne mangerais jamais quelque chose avec cette odeur épouvantable' - Even in front of the Supreme Court, I would never eat something with that terrible smell. 'Mangerais' is the conditional form of 'manger' (to eat), and 'odeur' means 'smell/odor'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - Supreme Court context

questions.audioText: Les soldats de l'armée paieront leurs cours en ligne pour obtenir des diplômes universitaires.
questions.question: What will the army soldiers pay for?
options: Their online courses to obtain university degrees
Their advanced military training equipment and materials
Their family housing accommodation on the military base
Their medical insurance coverage for active duty personnel
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'Their online courses to obtain university degrees'. The text states 'Les soldats de l'armée paieront leurs cours en ligne pour obtenir des diplômes universitaires' - The army soldiers will pay for their online courses to obtain university degrees. 'Paieront' is the future form of 'payer' (to pay), and 'armée' means 'army'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - military education context

questions.audioText: Plus la durée du spectacle s'allongeait, plus je devenais fatigué et ma vue se troublait.
questions.question: What happened as the duration of the show got longer?
options: The speaker became tired and their vision got blurry
The audience became more engaged and attentive to details
The performers increased their energy and stage presence
The lighting effects became more dramatic and impressive
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'The speaker became tired and their vision got blurry'. The text states 'Plus la durée du spectacle s'allongeait, plus je devenais fatigué et ma vue se troublait' - The longer the duration of the show got, the more tired I became and my vision got blurry. 'Devenais' is the imperfect form of 'devenir' (to become), and 'vue' means 'vision/sight'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - performance duration context

questions.audioText: Si vous mourez dans cette démission, vous mordrez votre lèvre de regret pour le reste de l'éternité.
questions.question: What will happen if you die in this resignation?
options: You will bite your lip with regret for all eternity
You will lose all your professional reputation permanently
You will disappoint your family and close friends deeply
You will miss all future career advancement opportunities
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'You will bite your lip with regret for all eternity'. The text states 'Si vous mourez dans cette démission, vous mordrez votre lèvre de regret pour le reste de l'éternité' - If you die in this resignation, you will bite your lip with regret for all eternity. 'Mourez' is the second-person plural present form of 'mourir' (to die), and 'lèvre' means 'lip'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - workplace resignation context

questions.audioText: Tu tiendras le microphone près de ta jambe pour modifier le timbre de ta voix pendant l'enregistrement.
questions.question: Where will you hold the microphone to modify your voice?
options: Near your leg to change the timber of your voice during recording
Close to your chest to amplify the sound projection naturally
Behind your back to create an echo effect in the studio
Above your head to capture the room's acoustic characteristics
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'Near your leg to change the timber of your voice during recording'. The text states 'Tu tiendras le microphone près de ta jambe pour modifier le timbre de ta voix pendant l'enregistrement' - You will hold the microphone near your leg to modify the timber of your voice during recording. 'Tiendras' is the future form of 'tenir' (to hold), 'jambe' means 'leg', and 'voix' means 'voice'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - audio recording context

questions.audioText: Ces légumes biologiques tombent sacrément vite quand ils sont trop mûrs pour la vente.
questions.question: What happens to these organic vegetables when they are too ripe for sale?
options: They fall incredibly fast
They lose their nutritional value completely
They develop an unpleasant bitter taste
They attract harmful insects and pests
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'They fall incredibly fast'. The text states 'Ces légumes biologiques tombent sacrément vite quand ils sont trop mûrs pour la vente' - These organic vegetables fall incredibly fast when they are too ripe for sale. 'Tombent' is the third-person plural present of 'tomber' (to fall), and 'sacrément' is an intensifying adverb meaning 'incredibly/really'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - organic farming context

questions.audioText: Quand tu tombes sur des documents familiaux, nous nous aidons mutuellement à préserver cet héritage précieux.
questions.question: What do we do when you come across family documents?
options: We help each other mutually to preserve this precious heritage
We organize them chronologically by date and family member
We scan them digitally to create permanent backup copies
We consult professional archivists for proper storage advice
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'We help each other mutually to preserve this precious heritage'. The text states 'Quand tu tombes sur des documents familiaux, nous nous aidons mutuellement à préserver cet héritage précieux' - When you come across family documents, we help each other mutually to preserve this precious heritage. 'Tombes' is the second-person singular present of 'tomber' (to fall/come across), and 'mutuellement' means 'mutually'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - family heritage context

questions.audioText: Son talent artistique tombera horriblement si elle ne pratique pas régulièrement son instrument de musique.
questions.question: What will happen to her artistic talent?
options: It will fall horribly if she doesn't practice her musical instrument regularly
It will improve dramatically with dedicated daily practice sessions
It will remain stable regardless of her practice frequency
It will develop in unexpected directions with creative exploration
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'It will fall horribly if she doesn't practice her musical instrument regularly'. The text states 'Son talent artistique tombera horriblement si elle ne pratique pas régulièrement son instrument de musique' - Her artistic talent will fall horribly if she doesn't practice her musical instrument regularly. 'Tombera' is the future form of 'tomber' (to fall), and 'horriblement' means 'horribly'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - artistic talent context

questions.audioText: Vous tombez nerveusement dans les pièges de la politique d'entreprise lors des réunions stratégiques.
questions.question: What do you nervously fall into during strategic meetings?
options: The traps of corporate politics
The pressure of making quick decisions under scrutiny
The habit of interrupting colleagues during presentations
The temptation to avoid difficult controversial topics
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'The traps of corporate politics'. The text states 'Vous tombez nerveusement dans les pièges de la politique d'entreprise lors des réunions stratégiques' - You nervously fall into the traps of corporate politics during strategic meetings. 'Tombez' is the second-person plural present of 'tomber' (to fall), and 'nerveusement' means 'nervously'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - corporate politics context

questions.audioText: Conformément aux prédictions du psychologue, sa motivation tombait chaque fois qu'il échouait à ses examens.
questions.question: According to the psychologist's predictions, when did his motivation fall?
options: Every time he failed his exams
When he received criticism from his teachers
After spending too many hours studying alone
During periods of intense academic pressure
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'Every time he failed his exams'. The text states 'Conformément aux prédictions du psychologue, sa motivation tombait chaque fois qu'il échouait à ses examens' - According to the psychologist's predictions, his motivation fell every time he failed his exams. 'Tombait' is the imperfect form of 'tomber' (to fall), and 'conformément' means 'in accordance with'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - academic motivation context

questions.audioText: Premièrement, en tombant sur cette conférence internationale, nous avons découvert de nouvelles opportunités de collaboration.
questions.question: What did we discover first by coming across this international conference?
options: New opportunities for collaboration
Advanced research methodologies in our field
Innovative technological solutions for current problems
Potential funding sources for future projects
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'New opportunities for collaboration'. The text states 'Premièrement, en tombant sur cette conférence internationale, nous avons découvert de nouvelles opportunités de collaboration' - First, by coming across this international conference, we discovered new opportunities for collaboration. 'Tombant' is the present participle of 'tomber' (to fall/come across), and 'premièrement' means 'firstly'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - academic conferences context

questions.audioText: Nous changeons légalement notre approche du réseautage professionnel pour respecter les nouvelles réglementations sur la confidentialité.
questions.question: Why are we legally changing our professional networking approach?
options: To comply with new privacy regulations
To improve our competitive advantage in the market
To reduce operational costs and increase efficiency
To expand into new international business markets
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'To comply with new privacy regulations'. The text states 'Nous changeons légalement notre approche du réseautage professionnel pour respecter les nouvelles réglementations sur la confidentialité' - We are legally changing our professional networking approach to comply with new privacy regulations. 'Changeons' is the first-person plural present of 'changer' (to change), and 'légalement' means 'legally'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - professional networking context

questions.audioText: Le patient entra vraisemblablement en rémission après ce traitement médical expérimental innovant.
questions.question: What probably happened to the patient after this innovative experimental medical treatment?
options: He probably entered remission
He experienced significant side effects requiring monitoring
He developed resistance to conventional therapy methods
He showed improved symptoms but required additional treatment
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'He probably entered remission'. The text states 'Le patient entra vraisemblablement en rémission après ce traitement médical expérimental innovant' - The patient probably entered remission after this innovative experimental medical treatment. 'Entra' is the third-person singular past simple of 'entrer' (to enter), and 'vraisemblablement' means 'probably/likely'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - medical treatment context

questions.audioText: Vous travailliez obscurément sur les questions de gouvernance d'entreprise sans révéler vos véritables intentions aux actionnaires.
questions.question: How were you working on corporate governance issues?
options: Obscurely without revealing your true intentions to shareholders
Transparently by providing detailed reports to all stakeholders
Collaboratively with external consultants and legal experts
Systematically following established industry best practices

The text states 'Vous travailliez obscurément sur les questions de gouvernance d'entreprise sans révéler vos véritables intentions aux actionnaires' - You were working obscurely on corporate governance issues without revealing your true intentions to shareholders. 'Travailliez' is the second-person plural imperfect of 'travailler' (to work), and 'obscurément' means 'obscurely'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - corporate governance context

questions.audioText: Vous perdrez toute honte si vous criez dans les musées comme des enfants mal élevés.

options: All shame
Your museum membership privileges permanently
The respect of other visitors and staff members
Your educational opportunities for cultural learning

The text states 'Vous perdrez toute honte si vous criez dans les musées comme des enfants mal élevés' - You will lose all shame if you shout in museums like badly behaved children. 'Perdrez' is the future form of 'perdre' (to lose), and 'honte' means 'shame'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - museum behavior context

questions.audioText: En tirant cet équipement lourd, il s'est blessé l'épaule droite pendant l'entraînement sportif.

options: He injured his right shoulder during sports training
He developed muscle cramps in his legs and back

He damaged the equipment beyond repair accidentally

The text states 'En tirant cet équipement lourd, il s'est blessé l'épaule droite pendant l'entraînement sportif' - While pulling this heavy equipment, he injured his right shoulder during sports training. 'Tirant' is the present participle of 'tirer' (to pull), and 'épaule' means 'shoulder'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - sports equipment context

questions.audioText: Je t'aiderais volontiers à comprendre les signes de fatigue musculaire dans la salle de sport.

options: The signs of muscle fatigue in the gym
The proper techniques for weight lifting exercises safely
The best nutrition plans for athletic performance improvement
The correct use of various fitness machines and equipment
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'The signs of muscle fatigue in the gym'. The text states 'Je t'aiderais volontiers à comprendre les signes de fatigue musculaire dans la salle de sport' - I would gladly help you understand the signs of muscle fatigue in the gym. 'Aiderais' is the conditional form of 'aider' (to help), and 'signes' means 'signs'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - gym fitness context

questions.audioText: Au contraire de tes habitudes, tu sentes maintenant les épices exotiques pendant que nous dînons ensemble.
questions.question: What does the person now sense contrary to their habits?
options: Exotic spices while we dine together
Different textures in the food preparation methods
Unusual cooking aromas from the kitchen area
New flavors in the traditional family recipes
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'Exotic spices while we dine together'. The text states 'Au contraire de tes habitudes, tu sentes maintenant les épices exotiques pendant que nous dînons ensemble' - Contrary to your habits, you now sense exotic spices while we dine together. 'Sentes' is the second-person singular present subjunctive of 'sentir' (to sense/smell), and 'contraire' means 'contrary'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - dining experience context

questions.audioText: Tu sentis une atmosphère tendue sur la scène culinaire quand les chefs des restaurants rivaux se rencontrèrent.
questions.question: When did you sense a tense atmosphere on the culinary scene?
options: When rival restaurant chefs met
During the final judging of the cooking competition
When the food critics arrived for their reviews
During the preparation of the signature dishes
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'When rival restaurant chefs met'. The text states 'Tu sentis une atmosphère tendue sur la scène culinaire quand les chefs des restaurants rivaux se rencontrèrent' - You sensed a tense atmosphere on the culinary scene when rival restaurant chefs met. 'Sentis' is the second-person singular past simple of 'sentir' (to sense), and 'scène' means 'scene'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - restaurant competition context

questions.audioText: Je tirerai des conclusions importantes de cette vue d'ensemble sur les expositions d'art contemporain.
questions.question: What will the speaker draw from this overview of contemporary art exhibitions?
options: Important conclusions
Inspiration for personal artistic projects and creations
Contacts with influential gallery owners and curators
Knowledge about current market trends and pricing
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'Important conclusions'. The text states 'Je tirerai des conclusions importantes de cette vue d'ensemble sur les expositions d'art contemporain' - I will draw important conclusions from this overview of contemporary art exhibitions. 'Tirerai' is the future form of 'tirer' (to draw/pull), and 'vue' means 'view/sight'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - art exhibitions context

questions.audioText: Tu mangeras tes mots écrits sur ce papier si les clients se plaignent de notre service clientèle.
questions.question: What will you eat if customers complain about our customer service?
options: Your words written on this paper
A humble meal while apologizing to disappointed clients
Your pride and admit mistakes to improve service quality
The cost of refunds and compensation for unhappy customers
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'Your words written on this paper'. The text states 'Tu mangeras tes mots écrits sur ce papier si les clients se plaignent de notre service clientèle' - You will eat your words written on this paper if customers complain about our customer service. 'Mangeras' is the future form of 'manger' (to eat), and 'papier' means 'paper'. The expression 'manger ses mots' means 'to eat one's words'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - customer service context

questions.audioText: Il ne faut jamais prendre de mauvais décisions quand on est en colère.
questions.question: Il ne faut jamais prendre de ______ décisions quand on est en colère.
options: mauvais
bonnes
rapides
importantes
questions.explanation: The context suggests you shouldn't make 'bad' decisions when angry. 'Mauvais' means bad/poor, which fits the warning about decision-making while emotional. The other options don't match the cautionary tone.

questions.audioText: Cette petite ville de montagne est vraiment joli avec ses chalets traditionnels.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu?
options: Cette petite ville de montagne est vraiment joli avec ses chalets traditionnels.
Cette petite ville de montagne est vraiment jolie avec ses chalets traditionnels.
Cette petite ville de montagne est vraiment joli avec ses maisons traditionnelles.
Cette grande ville de montagne est vraiment jolie avec ses chalets traditionnels.
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette petite ville de montagne est vraiment joli avec ses chalets traditionnels' - This small mountain town is really pretty with its traditional chalets. The exact phrase contained the agreement error 'joli' (masculine) instead of 'jolie' (feminine) to agree with 'ville' (feminine).

questions.audioText: Il semble impossible de résoudre ce problème technique sans assistance externe spécialisée.
questions.question: What seems impossible according to the speaker?
options: Solving this technical problem without specialized external assistance
Finding the right technical documentation for this problem
Completing the project within the given deadline
Understanding the complexity of the technical requirements
questions.explanation: The speaker states 'Il semble impossible de résoudre ce problème technique sans assistance externe spécialisée' - it seems impossible to solve this technical problem without specialized external assistance. The adjective 'impossible' means impossible/unfeasible.

questions.audioText: Nos situations professionnelles sont très pareilles : nous travaillons tous les deux dans l'informatique.
questions.question: Nos situations professionnelles sont très ______ : nous travaillons tous les deux dans l'informatique.
options: pareilles
pareil
pareils
pareille
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'pareilles' (feminine plural) to agree with 'situations' (feminine plural). The adjective 'pareil' means similar/alike, and the context explains they both work in IT, making their professional situations similar.

questions.audioText: Ce nouveau logiciel de conception graphique est absolument génial pour les designers professionnels.
questions.question: What does the speaker think about the new graphic design software?
options: It's absolutely brilliant for professional designers
It's too complicated for most users
It's outdated compared to other software
It's only suitable for beginners
questions.explanation: The speaker states 'Ce nouveau logiciel de conception graphique est absolument génial pour les designers professionnels' - this new graphic design software is absolutely brilliant for professional designers. The adjective 'génial' means brilliant/awesome/fantastic.

questions.audioText: L'appartement au cinquième étage offre une vue magnifique sur la ville grâce à sa position haute.
questions.question: L'appartement au cinquième étage offre une vue magnifique sur la ville grâce à sa position ______.
options: haut
haute
hauts
hautes
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'haute' (feminine singular) to agree with 'position' (feminine singular). The adjective 'haut' means high/elevated, and the context explains the apartment's great view is due to its high position.

questions.audioText: Les traditions culturelles restent vivant dans cette communauté rurale malgré la modernisation.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu?
options: Les traditions culturelles restent vivant dans cette communauté rurale malgré la modernisation.
Les traditions culturelles restent vivantes dans cette communauté rurale malgré la modernisation.
Les traditions culturelles restent vivant dans cette communauté urbaine malgré la modernisation.
Les traditions culturelles deviennent vivantes dans cette communauté rurale malgré la modernisation.
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les traditions culturelles restent vivant dans cette communauté rurale malgré la modernisation' - Cultural traditions remain alive in this rural community despite modernization. The exact phrase contained the agreement error 'vivant' (masculine singular) instead of 'vivantes' (feminine plural) to agree with 'traditions' (feminine plural).

questions.audioText: Nous habitons très proche de la gare, nous pouvons y aller à pied.
questions.question: Nous habitons très ______ de la gare, nous pouvons y aller à pied.
options: proche
proches
près
loin
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'proche' meaning close/near. The context indicates they can walk to the station, confirming proximity. 'Proche' is invariable when used with 'très' before 'de'. The phrase 'très proche de' means very close to.

questions.audioText: Les négociations diplomatiques pourraient aboutir à un accord si les parties acceptaient de faire des compromis.
questions.question: Les négociations diplomatiques ______ aboutir à un accord si les parties acceptaient de faire des compromis.
options: pourraient
pouvaient
pourront
peuvent
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'pourraient' (conditional of 'pouvoir'). The conditional expresses a hypothetical possibility: 'could lead to an agreement if...'. This matches the conditional structure with 'si' + imperfect ('acceptaient') in the if-clause.

questions.audioText: Mes parents pouvaient toujours m'emmener au parc le dimanche à l'époque où j'étais petit.
questions.question: What did the speaker's parents always do when he was little?
options: They could always take him to the park on Sundays
They would always take him to the park on Sundays
They had to take him to the park on Sundays
They wanted to take him to the park on Sundays
questions.explanation: The text states 'Mes parents pouvaient toujours m'emmener au parc le dimanche à l'époque où j'étais petit' - My parents could always take me to the park on Sundays back when I was little. 'Pouvaient' is the imperfect of 'pouvoir' (could/were able to), with the temporal clause repositioned at the end.

questions.audioText: Le directeur donnera sa réponse demain matin lors de la réunion.
questions.question: Le directeur ______ sa réponse demain matin lors de la réunion.
options: donnera
donne
donnait
donnerait
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'donnera' (future of 'donner'). The future tense is used because of 'demain matin' (tomorrow morning), indicating a future action. 'Le directeur donnera sa réponse' means 'The director will give his answer.'

questions.audioText: En regardant par la fenêtre, j'ai vu un accident de voiture.
questions.question: En ______ par la fenêtre, j'ai vu un accident de voiture.
options: regardant
regarder
regarde
regardais
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'regardant' (present participle of 'regarder'). The construction 'en + present participle' expresses simultaneous action: 'En regardant par la fenêtre' means 'while looking out the window'. This shows that seeing the accident happened while looking out.

questions.audioText: Le conducteur a été arrêté par la police pour excès de vitesse.
questions.question: What happened to the driver?
options: The driver was stopped by police for speeding.
The driver arrested a police officer for speeding.
The driver stopped to help police with speeding.
The driver was warned by police about speeding.
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'a été arrêté' (was stopped/arrested) - the past participle 'arrêté' combined with auxiliary verb 'être' in the passé composé. Here 'arrêté' means 'stopped' in the context of police stopping someone.

questions.audioText: Je vous aiderai à répondre à ces questions difficiles si vous restés concentrés.
questions.question: Je vous aiderai à répondre à ces ______ difficiles si vous restez concentrés.
options: questions
problèmes
exercices
examens
questions.explanation: The text states 'Je vous aiderai à répondre à ces questions difficiles si vous restez concentrés' - I will help you answer these difficult questions if you stay focused. 'Aiderai' is the future form of 'aider' (to help), targeting the missing conjugate plus under-represented 'helping', 'questions', and 'difficulty' topics.

questions.audioText: Si j'avais le temps, j'irais au cinéma avec vous.
questions.question: What would the speaker do if they had time?
options: Go to the cinema with you.
Stay home with you.
Go to the restaurant with you.
Go shopping with you.
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'irais' - the conditional form of 'aller' (to go). 'Si j'avais le temps, j'irais' means 'If I had time, I would go'. This is a typical conditional sentence structure in French.

questions.audioText: L'information a été donnée aux journalistes hier soir.
questions.question: What happened to the information?
options: It was given to journalists yesterday evening.
It was given to journalists this morning.
It was taken from journalists yesterday evening.
It was hidden from journalists yesterday evening.
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'donnée' - the past participle feminine form of 'donner' (to give). 'L'information a été donnée' means 'the information was given'. The past participle agrees with the feminine noun 'information'.

questions.audioText: Elle regarderait la télévision si elle avait du temps libre.
questions.question: What would she do if she had free time?
options: Watch television.
Read a book.
Listen to music.
Go for a walk.
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'regarderait' - the conditional form of 'regarder' (to watch/look at). 'Elle regarderait' means 'she would watch'. This is part of a conditional sentence expressing what would happen if she had free time.

questions.audioText: Le gouvernement a décidé de créer un service militaire obligatoire.
questions.question: What did the government decide to create?
options: A mandatory military service.
A voluntary military service.
A civilian service program.
A medical service program.
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'militaire' meaning 'military'. 'Un service militaire obligatoire' means 'a mandatory military service'. 'Militaire' is an adjective describing the type of service.

questions.audioText: Ce pesticide est devenu inutile contre les nouveaux parasites agricoles.
questions.question: What has happened to the pesticide?
options: It has become useless against new agricultural pests.
It has become useful against new agricultural pests.
It has become dangerous for new agricultural pests.
It has become expensive for new agricultural pests.
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'inutile' meaning 'useless/pointless'. 'Ce pesticide est devenu inutile' means 'this pesticide has become useless'. The context is agricultural pest control.

questions.audioText: Le bétail reste immobile pendant la forte chaleur estivale.
questions.question: What does the livestock do during the intense summer heat?
options: Stays motionless.
Moves around actively.
Searches for food.
Runs to the barn.
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'immobile' meaning 'motionless/still'. 'Le bétail reste immobile' means 'the livestock stays motionless'. Animals often remain still during intense heat to conserve energy.

questions.audioText: Cette proposition me paraît complètement ridicule.
questions.question: What does the speaker think about the proposal?
options: It seems completely ridiculous to them.
It seems completely reasonable to them.
It seems completely interesting to them.
It seems completely necessary to them.
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'ridicule' meaning 'ridiculous/absurd'. 'Cette proposition me paraît complètement ridicule' means 'this proposal seems completely ridiculous to me'. The speaker finds the proposal absurd.

questions.audioText: Il est nécessaire de prendre des mesures urgentes pour l'environnement.
questions.question: What is necessary according to the speaker?
options: Taking urgent measures for the environment.
Taking slow measures for the environment.
Taking optional measures for the environment.
Taking expensive measures for the environment.
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'nécessaire' meaning 'necessary/required'. 'Il est nécessaire de prendre des mesures urgentes' means 'it is necessary to take urgent measures'. The speaker emphasizes the requirement for environmental action.

questions.audioText: La situation économique est pire que l'année dernière.
questions.question: How is the economic situation compared to last year?
options: It is worse than last year.
It is better than last year.
It is the same as last year.
It is improving from last year.
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'pire' meaning 'worse'. 'La situation économique est pire que l'année dernière' means 'the economic situation is worse than last year'. 'Pire' is the comparative form indicating deterioration.

questions.audioText: Mes grands-parents allaient toujours à la messe le dimanche.
questions.question: What did the grandparents always do on Sundays?
options: They went to mass.
They went to the market.
They went to the park.
They went to visit friends.
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'allaient' - the imperfect form of 'aller' (to go) for ils/elles. 'Mes grands-parents allaient' means 'my grandparents used to go/were going'. The imperfect describes a habitual action in the past.

questions.audioText: Que ferez-vous pendant les vacances d'été ?
questions.question: What is being asked?
options: Que ferez-vous pendant les vacances d'été ?
Que feriez-vous pendant les vacances d'été ?
Que faites-vous pendant les vacances d'été ?
Qu'avez-vous fait pendant les vacances d'été ?
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'ferez' - the future form of 'faire' (to do/make) for vous. 'Que ferez-vous' means 'what will you do'. This is asking about future vacation plans using the simple future tense.

questions.audioText: Que feriez-vous si vous aviez plus de temps libre ?
questions.question: What kind of question is being asked?
options: A hypothetical question about having more free time.
A direct question about current free time activities.
A question about past free time activities.
A question about someone else's free time.
questions.explanation: The full French question is "Que feriez-vous si vous aviez plus de temps libre ?". It uses 'feriez' - the conditional form of 'faire' (to do/make) for vous. 'Que feriez-vous si...' means 'what would you do if...'. This is a hypothetical conditional question structure.

questions.audioText: Cette émission a été regardée par des millions de téléspectateurs.
questions.question: What happened to this TV show?
options: It was watched by millions of viewers.
It was criticized by millions of viewers.
It was ignored by millions of viewers.
It was recorded by millions of viewers.
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'regardée' - the past participle feminine form of 'regarder' (to watch). 'Cette émission a été regardée' means 'this show was watched'. The past participle agrees with the feminine noun 'émission'.

questions.audioText: Ce pesticide tue les insectes nuisibles mais préserve les abeilles.
questions.question: What does this pesticide do to harmful insects?
options: It kills them.
It repels them.
It attracts them.
It transforms them.
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'tue' - the present form of 'tuer' (to kill) for il/elle. 'Ce pesticide tue' means 'this pesticide kills'. The sentence describes a selective pesticide that kills harmful insects but preserves bees.

questions.audioText: Quand nous étions jeunes, nous allions souvent au parc le dimanche.
questions.question: Where did they often go on Sundays when they were young?
options: To the park.
To the beach.
To the cinema.
To the museum.
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'allions' - the imperfect form of 'aller' (to go) for nous. 'Nous allions' means 'we used to go/were going'. The imperfect describes a habitual action in the past.

questions.audioText: Vous irez au marché acheter des légumes frais pour le dîner.
questions.question: Why will you go to the market?
options: To buy fresh vegetables for dinner.
To buy fresh fruits for breakfast.
To buy fresh meat for lunch.
To buy fresh bread for dinner.
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'irez' - the future form of 'aller' (to go) for vous. 'Vous irez au marché' means 'you will go to the market'. The purpose is to buy fresh vegetables ('légumes frais') for dinner.

questions.audioText: Cette lettre a été laissée sur votre bureau ce matin.
questions.question: What happened to the letter?
options: It was left on your desk this morning.
It was sent from your desk this morning.
It was written on your desk this morning.
It was read on your desk this morning.
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'laissée' - the past participle feminine form of 'laisser' (to leave). 'Cette lettre a été laissée' means 'this letter was left'. The past participle agrees with the feminine noun 'lettre'.

questions.audioText: Il faut que tu fasses attention aux meubles anciens dans cette maison.
questions.question: What does the speaker want the listener to do?
options: Be careful with the antique furniture in this house
Move the old furniture out of this house
Clean the antique furniture in this house
Buy new furniture for this house
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'fasses' - the subjunctive form of 'faire' (to do/make) for tu. 'Il faut que tu fasses attention' means 'you must pay attention/be careful'. The subjunctive is required after 'il faut que'.

questions.audioText: Les enfants voulaient avoir un chien comme animal de compagnie.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu?
options: Les enfants voulaient avoir un chien comme animal de compagnie.
Les enfants voulaient avoir un chat comme animal de compagnie.
Les enfants voulaient avoir un oiseau comme animal de compagnie.
Les enfants voulaient avoir un lapin comme animal de compagnie.
questions.explanation: La phrase exacte était 'Les enfants voulaient avoir un chien comme animal de compagnie.' - The children wanted to have a dog as a pet. 'Voulaient' is the imperfect form of 'vouloir' for ils/elles.

questions.audioText: Il faut que tu saches comment arroser les plantes du jardin.
questions.question: What does the speaker want the listener to know?
options: How to water the garden plants
How to plant seeds in the garden
How to trim the garden hedges
How to harvest the garden vegetables
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il faut que tu saches comment arroser les plantes du jardin' - You must know how to water the garden plants. The verb 'saches' is the subjunctive form of 'savoir' (to know), which is required after 'il faut que' (it's necessary that).

questions.audioText: Nous avons vus tous les chats du refuge hier avant l'adoption.
questions.question: What did they see at the shelter yesterday?
options: All the cats before the adoption event
All the dogs before the adoption event
All the birds before the adoption event
All the rabbits before the adoption event
questions.explanation: The text states 'Nous avons vus tous les chats du refuge hier avant l'adoption' - We saw all the cats at the shelter yesterday before the adoption. The past participle 'vus' agrees with the direct object 'chats' (masculine plural).

questions.audioText: J'aimerais qu'elle vienne m'aider à jardiner ce week-end.
questions.question: What does the speaker want?
options: For her to come help with gardening this weekend
For her to come help with cooking this weekend
For her to come help with cleaning this weekend
For her to come help with shopping this weekend
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'vienne' - the subjunctive form of 'venir' (to come) for il/elle. 'J'aimerais qu'elle vienne' means 'I would like her to come'. The subjunctive is required after expressions of desire like 'j'aimerais que'.

questions.audioText: Les lapins suivent un régime alimentaire composé principalement de légumes du jardin.
questions.question: What do the rabbits follow?
options: A diet mainly composed of garden vegetables
A strict exercise routine in the garden
A daily schedule for garden maintenance
A path through the garden every morning
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'suivent' - the present form of 'suivre' (to follow) for ils/elles. 'Les lapins suivent un régime alimentaire' means 'the rabbits follow a diet'. The diet consists mainly of garden vegetables.

questions.audioText: Cette décision a été prise après consultation de tous les propriétaires d'animaux du quartier.
questions.question: When was this decision made?
options: After consulting all pet owners in the neighborhood
Before consulting all pet owners in the neighborhood
During a meeting with all pet owners in the neighborhood
Without consulting any pet owners in the neighborhood
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'prise' - the past participle of 'prendre' (to take) in feminine form, agreeing with 'décision'. 'Cette décision a été prise' means 'this decision was taken/made'. It was made after consulting all pet owners.

questions.audioText: Nous devons chercher ailleurs pour trouver une solution à ce problème complexe.
questions.question: Nous devons chercher ______ pour trouver une solution à ce problème complexe.
options: ailleurs
dehors
partout
nulle part
questions.explanation: The adverb 'ailleurs' means 'elsewhere' or 'somewhere else', indicating that they need to look in other places or consider other options to find a solution to this complex problem.

questions.audioText: Le projet semblait difficile, pourtant nous avons réussi à le terminer dans les délais prévus.
questions.question: What does the speaker express about the project?
options: Despite appearing difficult, they managed to complete it on time
Because it was difficult, they finished it late
It was easy and they completed it quickly
They failed to complete the difficult project
questions.explanation: The adverb 'pourtant' means 'however' or 'yet', expressing a contrast. The speaker acknowledges the project seemed difficult, but despite this difficulty, they successfully completed it within the planned timeframe.

questions.audioText: Les étudiants restent debout pendant l'hymne national.
questions.question: Les étudiants restent ______ pendant l'hymne national.
options: debout
assis
silencieux
attentifs
questions.explanation: The adverb 'debout' means 'standing' or 'upright'. It indicates that the students remain in a standing position during the national anthem, which is a common respectful gesture.

questions.audioText: Nous allons prendre le déjeuner, ensuite nous visiterons le musée d'art moderne.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Nous allons prendre le déjeuner, ensuite nous visiterons le musée d'art moderne.
Nous allons prendre le déjeuner, puis nous visiterons le musée d'art moderne.
Nous allons prendre le déjeuner, enfin nous visiterons le musée d'art moderne.
Nous allons prendre le déjeuner, après nous visiterons le musée d'art moderne.
questions.explanation: The speaker used 'ensuite' (then/afterwards) to indicate the sequence of activities. The other options use different temporal adverbs: 'puis' (then), 'enfin' (finally), or 'après' (after).

questions.audioText: As-tu déjà visité ce nouveau restaurant près de la gare ?
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: As-tu déjà visité ce nouveau restaurant près de la gare ?
As-tu déjà visité ce nouveau restaurant près de la mairie ?
Vas-tu déjà visiter ce nouveau restaurant près de la gare ?
As-tu déjà visité ce vieux restaurant près de la gare ?
questions.explanation: The speaker used 'déjà' (already/yet) to ask if someone has visited the new restaurant near the train station. The other options change key details: 'mairie' (city hall), 'vas-tu...visiter' (future tense), or 'vieux' (old instead of new).

questions.audioText: Dans l'armée, vous teniez à maintenir vos routines de soins personnels malgré les conditions difficiles sur le terrain.
questions.question: What did you insist on maintaining in the army despite difficult field conditions?
options: Your personal care routines
Regular communication with family members back home
Strict adherence to scheduled meal times daily
Weekly physical fitness training sessions consistently
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'Your personal care routines'. The text states 'Dans l'armée, vous teniez à maintenir vos routines de soins personnels malgré les conditions difficiles sur le terrain' - In the army, you insisted on maintaining your personal care routines despite difficult field conditions. 'Teniez' is the second-person plural imperfect of 'tenir' (to hold/insist), and 'armée' means 'army'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - military personal care context

questions.audioText: Pendant que je mangeais en regardant ce thriller politique, le président disparaissait mystérieusement, créant un suspense insoutenable.
questions.question: What happened to the president while the speaker was eating and watching this political thriller?
options: He mysteriously disappeared, creating unbearable suspense
He made an unexpected announcement that shocked the nation
He was involved in a conspiracy that gradually unfolded
He faced a crisis that tested his leadership abilities
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'He mysteriously disappeared, creating unbearable suspense'. The text states 'Pendant que je mangeais en regardant ce thriller politique, le président disparaissait mystérieusement, créant un suspense insoutenable' - While I was eating and watching this political thriller, the president was mysteriously disappearing, creating unbearable suspense. 'Mangeais' is the imperfect form of 'manger' (to eat), and 'président' means 'president'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - political thriller context

questions.audioText: Tu joueras un rôle important dans l'échange interculturel quand tu visiteras ce village traditionnel avec les étudiants internationaux.
questions.question: What role will you play when visiting this traditional village with international students?
options: An important role in intercultural exchange
A guide explaining local customs and traditions to visitors
A translator helping with communication barriers effectively
A coordinator organizing educational activities for the group
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'An important role in intercultural exchange'. The text states 'Tu joueras un rôle important dans l'échange interculturel quand tu visiteras ce village traditionnel avec les étudiants internationaux' - You will play an important role in intercultural exchange when you visit this traditional village with international students. 'Joueras' is the future form of 'jouer' (to play), and 'village' means 'village'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - cultural exchange context

questions.audioText: Je perdrais complètement le contrôle de mes gestes si tu me laisses seul avec cette responsabilité écrasante.
questions.question: What would the speaker completely lose control of if left alone with this overwhelming responsibility?
options: Their gestures
Their emotional reactions to stressful situations completely
Their ability to make rational decisions under pressure
Their capacity to communicate effectively with others
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'Their gestures'. The text states 'Je perdrais complètement le contrôle de mes gestes si tu me laisses seul avec cette responsabilité écrasante' - I would completely lose control of my gestures if you leave me alone with this overwhelming responsibility. 'Perdrais' is the conditional form of 'perdre' (to lose), and 'geste' means 'gesture'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - letting go context

questions.audioText: Je mourais d'envie de rejoindre cette scène de collaboration académique internationale entre chercheurs multidisciplinaires.
questions.question: What was the speaker dying to join?
options: This scene of international academic collaboration between multidisciplinary researchers
A prestigious research institute with advanced laboratory facilities
An exclusive conference for leading experts in their field
A competitive fellowship program for outstanding scholars
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'This scene of international academic collaboration between multidisciplinary researchers'. The text states 'Je mourais d'envie de rejoindre cette scène de collaboration académique internationale entre chercheurs multidisciplinaires' - I was dying to join this scene of international academic collaboration between multidisciplinary researchers. 'Mourais' is the imperfect form of 'mourir' (to die), and 'scène' means 'scene'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - academic collaboration context

questions.audioText: Au contraire de nos attentes, vous aidiez vraiment les équipes de recherche interdisciplinaire à surmonter leurs différences méthodologiques.
questions.question: Contrary to expectations, what were you really helping interdisciplinary research teams do?
options: Overcome their methodological differences
Secure additional funding for their ambitious projects
Publish their findings in prestigious academic journals
Establish partnerships with international institutions
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'Overcome their methodological differences'. The text states 'Au contraire de nos attentes, vous aidiez vraiment les équipes de recherche interdisciplinaire à surmonter leurs différences méthodologiques' - Contrary to our expectations, you were really helping interdisciplinary research teams overcome their methodological differences. 'Aidiez' is the second-person plural imperfect of 'aider' (to help), and 'contraire' means 'contrary'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - interdisciplinary research context

questions.audioText: Vous écoutiez attentivement les annonces de départ des trains pendant que nous attendions sur le quai.
questions.question: What were you listening to attentively while we waited on the platform?
options: Train departure announcements
Weather updates for our destination city today
Safety instructions from the station personnel
Conversations between other passengers nearby
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'Train departure announcements'. The text states 'Vous écoutiez attentivement les annonces de départ des trains pendant que nous attendions sur le quai' - You were listening attentively to train departure announcements while we waited on the platform. 'Écoutiez' is the second-person plural imperfect of 'écouter' (to listen), and 'départ' means 'departure'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - train station context
